caption: I had the pleasure of spending a lovely Saturday evening here, this spring covid, catching up and chatting with a friend I haven't seen in almost a year. The staff were immediately attentive and welcoming and accommodating to no end!  We moved seats once, and asked for two windows and the door to be closed because it started to cool down quite a bit. (ie it was chilly af!) Maybe we were lucky but the place wasn't crowded at all so we were happy to sit inside as well.  Now the food! We had a bottle of wine, Donna Laura Chianti '15 was rather nice and we both got some salads and mains a pizza and tagliatelle bolognese!  We stayed and chatted until they closed up shop and we weren't rushed out once. In short, lovely people, tasty food, great feel around.
Incredible pizza!!!
Delicious neapolitan pizza. Soft, chewy crust. Ordered Cacio y pepe pizza and montanara fried pizza. Also had arachini and caesar salad. Would recommend a visit!
(Translated by Google) Nice setting great food is to try the fried calzone  (Original) Ambiente carino ottimo cibo è da provare il calzone fritto
Great pizza, very fresh ingredients, thin crust!
People giving bad reviews because of the half baked  decision to order through a third party app have misplaced their criticism. Awesome Neapolitan pizza place

Their pizza is really delicious! I particularly love the mortadella, pistachio and burrata one. Having said that, we ordered through Slice and the pizza ($50 all inclusive!) was delivered over 1h30 later. I tried to call the restaurant several times but got a busy tone. So if you order for delivery just make sure you’re not in a rush.

I give my experience with Pizza Secret 2 stars not for the food I ordered but for the service. I enjoyed my Margherita pizza and would have given it 4 stars based on taste. The problem was that it arrived an hour late and every time my partner and I tried calling the restaurant, the line was busy. Good food, but a poor time trying to find out what happened to our order for it to be so late to no avail.

Amo Pizza Secret! The brick oven pizza is delicious! The tartufo pizza and Americana are my go-to's. I'd also recommend any of their pastas, salads and apps! Delivery is always on time and everyone who works there is so friendly. We've missed dining inside with the staff and owner, who is from Italy. If you're looking for delicious authentic Italian food, order from Pizza Secret!
(Translated by Google) Like at home Great Rosary!  (Original) Come a casa Grande Rosario!

Wow, what a let down. We ordered for a Sunday delivery and got not only a raw undercooked and unevenly sliced pizza, but one that looks more like a cheese vs a margherita pizza. Look at that sad wilted piece of basil! For the price paid, I could get a better pie from any Joe's Pizza for way less.
I've been here several times and it always was amazing! One of the best pizza in NYC, the dough is perfect! Try the "burrata&pistacchio" or the "fried pizza"!
Great place, excellent food and wine
Best Neapolitan style pizza in Brooklyn! Delicious!
Ordered two pizzas for pickup. Wait time was almost nothing, and the pizza is delicious, with good quality ingredients and chewy crust. Will be ordering again!
Rosario is the best! Ignore any one star reviews on here, his food is amazing. Go check him out if you haven't already!
Amazing food and AMAZING service. Waiter was so kind and had nice conversation. Definitely would recommend eating here and I will be back.

Do not order delivery from here if you’d like to eat dinner tonight. I placed an order online that never showed up and was marked as delivered. When I called the restaurant 40 minutes later about the problem I encountered several busy signals and after finally connecting was placed on hold and never spoken to after that. They made no attempt to fix it whatsoever, didn’t even apologize. I used to be a big fan but will never be ordering from them again.
Best Napolitan pizza in NY

Pizza was extremely soggy. Seriously considered sending it back, but we were tired and hungry and just wanted to get on with it. Atmosphere was nice though, staff was friendly. Maybe the rest of the food is good, but I wouldn't bother with the pizza, it didn't seem like the kind of thing that was just an outlier.  We had the Margherita.
Pizza was delicious! Valeria is the best!!
Real staff!!!

I've only had the pizza here (Margherita, Bufala DOP, Polpettina & Ricotta) and it is absolutely delicious! If you like Neapolitan pizza, this is the place to go! The flavors are rich and mouth watering, the cheese is fresh, the dough is precisely baked. I felt like I was back in Sorrento & Naples. I'll make the effort to try their pasta side dishes on one of my future visits. Their pizza is just so delicious that I want to try them all first.
Pizza way too burnt and oily.

I m Italian from Milano and I just move to Brooklyn a months ago I had the most incredible pizza 🍕 my favorite pizza is the Americana ( I know it’s not really Italian but is amazing even the honey spicy oil ) Anytime I stop by for pizza I feel at home The atmosphere is amazing and the owner it’s so friendly and a gentleman, even the waitress Valeria is so friendly and definitely give me a good vibe and make me feel at home with her hospitality and unforgettable laugh !!! Stop by and you will be happy !!!!
Maybe the pizza is good but we’ve had all of the appetizers, and they are usually cold or underprepared. Especially anything with meat.

Authentic neapolitan pizza with quality ingredients, well prepared dough and cooked by using the wood fired oven at its best. That's in my view the secret. Happy to patronize again this business that prioritizes quality even during tough times for the sector. We picked up our pizzas and did not dine in.

Totally ripped us off!! My sister ordered a plate that was too salty. They took it back and charged her for it. Then they ran out of lasagna. The waitress suggested the Pasta ala bolognese and it would taste like lasagna because it was the same meat sauce. I told her that is not the same lasagna has cheese. She no problem I can add some cheese for you and added $4 to each. The food plates was just ok and pizza had a lot of charred parts. We certainly will not be coming back again! The waitress was nice though.
Its no Secret how delicious this pizza is..
Great pizza and great staff!

(Translated by Google) I've never been there because for now going to New York is a dream but seeing it on TV it already deserves the 5 stars, yes fort uajo  (Original) Non ci sono mai stato perché per adesso andare a New York è un sogno ma vedendolo in TV si merita già le 5 stelle, si fort uajo
Great! A little expensive but some of the best pasta I've had in a while

After an enjoyable experience with our daughter and son-in law we decided to come back last Friday evening. We started with Fritto DMare and Mistranza insulate.Calamari and shrimp were light and fresh tasting.Mistranza insulate was a  generous portion that was on point.Margherita pizza had light and airy crust with a nice crisp.Rosario’s Neapolitan style resonates flavors that give that home cook feeling. Maureen and Larry
Good pizza! Good service! Owner is really courteous! Recommend!
Pizza came out piping hot, fresh and full of Flavor. Definitely will be back soon.

We went last night to celebrate my nephews 30th Birthday. We were 12 people. We had appetizers, then each one of us ordered our own pizza. Delicious is all I can say. I had the pizza with burrata, ham and pistachio pesto. Omg. My sister had the truffle oil, mushroom pizza. She said it was great not over powering with truffle oil. I had 2 aperol cocktails others had beer and wine. Then for dessert we had them make us tiramisu cake. I had 2 pieces thats how good it was. Definitely worth the trip. I would go once a week if I wasn’t watching my weight lol.
I’ve been three times and each has been amazing. Authentic Neapolitan style pizza and calzones, great vibe, and kind staff. Absolutely delicious!
Amazing pizza made into a real pizza wooden oven. Very nice ambiance, I could spend an entire evening there. Very great discovery tonite
Delicious!
The crust is so good I would eat it by itself.

It's a authentic italian place. For good tasting wood fire pizza and tasty pasta. The taste is a bit sour to my taste, but the flavours are very good and has freshness to their food. The staff are nice a friendly. The best part about the place is it's ambience, after dark you can enjoy a nice romantic candle light dinner.located at a very nice corner of park slope, a must try
Very comfortable seating area and great wood oven in the dining room. I had literally the first pizza of the day, I expect the results are better later in the night.
(Translated by Google) A nice place and very good pizza.  (Original) Un lugar  agradable y muy buena  pizza.

Incredible wood-fired crust; the kind that makes you want to save some for later as a snack. Loads of toppings, and a pie will either leave you feeling stuffed or can be split between two people to go with an appetizer if you're looking to avoid that food baby. The service was fully attentive and engaged, and was every bit as much a delight as the pizza. Looking forward to coming back!
The panna cotta with nutella was delicious!!!
Great pizza, didn't want to waste time taking my phone out for a picture
Best pizza in NYC.
Amazing pizza and what a great service absolutely the nicest waiter I've ever ever ever seen. If u want good pizza COME HERE!!!!!!!
Classy and welcomed respectfuly, pizza is good I recommend this spot.
Pizza Secret is a must! The pizza here is authentic from Napoli and fittingly delicious. The family running the restaurant make you feel at home in their welcoming, lovely restaurant. 10/10 must go!

Went for a birthday with a group of friends (9 total) and they were very accommodating for a large group and even served the birthday cake we brought for us. They really fill the dining room in here, but they make it work!  A couple of mix-ups on our orders, but they gladly fixed those when we clarified (although we had to fix the bill later). Food comes out quick and the pizzas and calzone were super tasty and true Neapolitan style.
The pizza is AMAZING!!!! Service is wonderful and the tiramisu is unbelievably delicious.
Fantastic place. Honest fresh and delicious authentic food. The service is also exceptional

Changing my review to 1 star after my most recent visit. The pizza chef first sneezed and later coughed in his hands (not even elbow/arm), after which he continued to prepare the next pizza including toppings with his hands. This is unacceptable for any restaurant, no matter how good your pizza is (and don’t get me wrong, the pizza here is really good). After witnessing this I can’t visit this place anymore. Sottocasa and Barboncino are good alternatives for Neapolitan pizza in the area.
Service is terrible, extremely slow!

(Translated by Google) We had dinner in this pizzeria on Christmas Eve and we met with the family. Rosario is an exceptional pizza chef, the cheese and pepper pizza that I ate will carry in my heart as well as Giovanni's pastiera. If you don't know what to choose, ask the waiter Enzo for advice: number one :)  (Original) Abbiamo cenato in questa pizzeria la vigilia di Natale e ci siamo trovati in famiglia. Rosario è un pizzaiolo eccezionale, la pizza cacio e pepe che ho mangiato me la porterò nel cuore così come la pastiera di Giovanni. Se non sapete cosa scegliere, chiedete consiglio al cameriere Enzo, number uno :)

I'm not a NY native came here after the Nets game. So I don't know if I "should have" gone here. But, honestly the pizza was bomb. Loved that it was wood oven. We got a meatball and ricotta  pizza as well as a tartufo. Insane!! The pasta was also amazing!  The only thing I will say was the bathroom was almost dangerous. It's obvious that only men work here bc there's not even a spot where toilet paper would go...  Not enough for me to discount the delicious food though. Service could be better but it didn't ruin my experience until I was ready to leave.
Really welcoming atmosphere, great food and drink selection. The pasta and pizza are all wonderful.
The music and atmosphere was great. Food was good but, everything was in small portions. The waiter wasn't around. Kept going in and out of the restaurant. Over all it was a good experience.
The secret is that this is the best Neapolitan style pizza in the city!!!
Beautiful pizza!

Honestly the best pizza in Park Slope. If you are looking for great service, cute ambience and authentic neapolitan pies, this is the spot. Rosario is the best - always treats everyone like family. We go there at least 2-3 times a month. Enjoy!

The pizza is good. We ordered the fried calamari and it was full of oil and tasted like oil not like seafood, the marinara sauce that came with it wasn't that good either. Also, the portion was very small for an $18 appetizer. The service is good, they are very attentive and the restaurant is very nice inside.

(Translated by Google) Good music, nice atmosphere, exquisite smells and flavors! An incredible place to spend with family or with your partner ... intimate but at the same time how to be at home. We were attended by the owner who crowned our dinner with a Tiramisu and a lemoncello ... I have tried good pizza in NYC, no how is it !! Sublime Definitely something to visit if you stop by! I will definitely be back!  (Original) Buena música, ambiente agradable, olores y sabores exquisitos! Un lugar increíble para pasar en familia o con tu pareja...intimo pero a la vez cómo estar en casa. Nos atendió el dueño que coronó nuestra cena con un Tiramisu y un lemoncello...He probado buena pizza en NYC, ninguna cómo está!! Sublime Definitivamente algo que visitar si pasas por aquí!! Definitivamente volveré!

(Translated by Google) Very nice atmosphere, the pizzas are very good and Rosario (the Brazilian owner) is a genius, super cool. Highly recommended.  (Original) Ambiente muy agradable, las pizzas son buenísimas y Rosario (el dueño brasilero) es un genio, super buena onda. Muy recomendable.

I am absolutely amazed that such a place was available to me!  Food was amazing!  Wine selection was wonderful!  Atmosphere was romantic and cozy with a great window to see the outside world.  Host was gracious and spent time with us to make sure our needs were met.  It felt like home, and I was battling tears as I had to leave.  Recommended hands down!  Thank you for such a wonderful experience!

Went here again tonight and after another great meal it reminded me that I must write a review. This is our fail safe restaurant in the area. The pizza is always delicious and the service is very friendly. Everyone we have brought here loves it. My only piece of feedback is that it can be noisy and hard to hear sometimes - Perhaps something the owner might want to be mindful of when it's winter, all the windows are closed, the music is loud and there is no fabric to absorb noise. (I am, however, more conscious of this because I'm hard of hearing and struggle with background noise)
Authentic Napolitan style pizza, brick oven and abundant topping. Must try
(Translated by Google) Compliments for the pizza!  (Original) Complimenti per la pizza!
Real Italian pizza! 4 Formaggi and Capricciosa are amazing.
Authentic Neapolitan Pizza. Amazing food, beautiful and cozy restaurant, and excellent service. Worth the trip to Brooklyn. The owner was a real gentleman... Thanks for the great experience!
Food was delicious. Service was amazing.

(Translated by Google) If you are looking for Neapolitan pizza, it is definitely the best pizzeria you can find in New York. Even the other dishes are absolutely authentic, it's like eating at grandma's house on a Sunday! A must try!  (Original) Se si cerca pizza napoletana, è sicuramente migliore pizzeria che si può trovare a New York. Anche gli altri piatti sono assolutamente autentici, è come mangiare a casa della nonna la domenica! Da provare assolutamente!
Great people, nice atmosphere, Rosario is an awesome host, and the pizza is outstanding
Delicious pizza! I can't wait to try another one... The guy that makes the pizza was super attentive and nice.
Definitely one of the best pizza places in Park Slope
Excellent
SO DELICIOUS. The pasta and pizza were amazing! Some of the best food I’ve had in the city.
Excellent spot, excellent food  The tiramisu is outlandishly fantastic.

This is a fantastic pizza place. Had the pizza with the honey spice olive oil (a first for me) and thought it was brilliant. Great to taste something new after eating pizza for decades.  Service was super friendly and fast as well, the good reviews here are well deserved.
Amazing pizza, very authentic big drinks too
Great food and service!
Great Neapolitan Pizza

I like this place, and it’s close to getting more stars, it’s just missing some easily fixable things:  • There’s no cocktail menu to speak of, just a drink or two and it’s not good. A few drinks beyond wine and beer with pizza makes all the difference.  • The place is hot in the summer. No a/c that I’ve ever seen. There’s a lot of wood and it heats up. Make it more comfortable for the people eating hot pizza.  • The service is slow. Often, asking for the check is an affair that can take 20 minutes. When there’s no a/c, well that’s really annoying.  The pizza is good. The location is good. The people are nice. These are things that are easily fixable and hopefully some helpful suggestions get them to 4 or 5 stars.
Lucario treated us like family- made sure we were well fed with fantastic Napolitano cuisine. Also, the tiramisu is divine😇
Excellent food, great atmosphere and even better service. Viva Italia Try their Tiramisu....
Amazing pizza!!! Food is very good overall but the pizza...!!!
I walked into the store looking to see what i can get to take out and before I could walk into the store a very heavy set man with gold chain told me to go to a different store.... I wonder why 🤦🏿‍♂️

Worst Italian restaurant on 5th ave. The pizza was undercooked but burnt on the bottom, and the "ragu" was something that tasted like chicken soup and canned beef tendons over pasta. Terrible food. Service was great.

Pizza burnt on one side, undercooked on the other and a soggy mess in the middle. How does that happen? Beef ragu pasta tasted like a can of chicken noodle soup opened into a plate of pasta. Underwhelming food. Service was good.
Comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food.

Pizza Secret could be one of the best restaurants in the 5 boroughs. First of all, the pizza is exceptional. If you’re a fan of authentic, brick oven Neapolitan pizza, this is the place for you. The ingredients are fresh. The pizza is made promptly in the onsite oven. The taste is outstanding. The quality of service at Pizza Secret only enhances the dining experience. I’ve dined on multiple occasions and have been impressed with the kindness and thoroughness of the waitstaff. I always feel like I’m visiting an old friend. And Rosario, the owner, is one of the most genuine people I’ve met in my life. He is a good person who takes pride in creating a high quality environment for his patrons. If you haven’t been already, please visit Pizza Secret. It’s well worth the trip.
Delicious pizza and very good service I love 👍🏻
Pizza was very good. Give it a try and enjoy.

Great atmosphere. Staff is very kind and welcoming. Pizza was very fresh and there is a lot of variety to choose from. I wanted to try everything on the menu. The owner was nice enough to bring us a fresh dessert on the house.

Pizzas were delivered in a hot mess.  The toppings had completely slid off.  I sent pictures and restaurant owner refused to refund.  This restaurant doesn't stand by its product and doesn't deserve business.  Never order here.
Great pizza, good service
Amazing pizza and pasta made by real Italians!
(Translated by Google) Neapolitan pizza well executed. Relaxed and informal atmosphere.  (Original) Pizza napolitana bien ejecutada. Ambiente relajado e informal.
Lovely food, great staff, a little bit overpriced in my opinion but good.
Wonderful experience. Beautiful music and energy.
I love trying new places in this awesome city and I will tell you they have a damn good wood fire pizza!  However you like it.  Give this place a go!

The pizza/pasta is very good. But I'm sorry to say that the service is not.  We ordered an appetizer, then I ordered a pasta dish and my husband ordered a pizza. My pasta arrived before the appetizer.  In fact, neither my appetizer nor my husband's pizza ever arrived. The waitress was very apologetic but....

First time we went there everything was good, pizza was great, fast, etc. Since then we recommended the place to so many friends and now I’m kind of regretting this.  We went last night for the last time, we arrived there and there were many tables free but they were “reserved”. We waited 15 mins in the cold just to find out that one (and possible more) table was free. We were three, we get two semiclean dishes. We had to went to the bar to ask for Water, glasses, an extra plate, glasses for our beers, etc etc. I can’t remember how many times we had to go and ask for things that were missing. We order three appetizers and two pizzas, the arancini were the worst I ever had, the frito misto was pure sadness, the crostini were way too toasted, I mean, pure disappointment. The pizzas were ok but cold.  Clearly the two waiters were too busy and occupied with the big table, I guess big table big tip?  The rest of the tables were all complaining, three times we got the food that intended for the next table, we ended up delivering it ourselves.  I feel for this restaurant, the first time we went it was great, yesterday was terrible. We are not coming back.

I’ve been here probably 10 or more times, and it never disappoints! I’ve been to 50+ pizza spots in Brooklyn, and this is a true Neapolitan-style pizza spot with a wood oven to give the pizza the perfect cook and flavor. The pizza dough crust is the perfect balance of doughy with a crisp, and they only use the highest-quality fresh Italian ingredients. Someone here clearly loves to cook!
Personally, one of the best pizzas I had so far in NYC. And rarely seen such a passionate patron. Super nice guy. Will definitely cross half of the city to just get some pizza

We have ordered pizza from here a few times and like it. Today we ate at the restaurant. We had the margherita and the one with honey that's spicy, and a simple pasta. The pasta was nice. The pizzas were a bit soggy but tasty. Service was a bit all over the place.
Two thumbs up

I came in on my birthday and the owner personally took care of me on my special day. After the delicious pizza, the owner came with a Nutella Pizza singing “Happy Birthday” to me. He even offered us some lemoncelo at the end of the dinner. It was such a great experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves pizza and good Italian food. I traveled every year to italy and I can assure you that eating at Pizza Secret made me feel like I was in Italy. The Italian music in the background was amazing and so was the owner of the restaurant!

Ordered delivery through Slice app, pizza was cold by the second time the guy made it over (he says he knocked on the whole complex’s door and rang our bell but we heard nothing the first time, and no phone call). Pizza was small (12”) but nowhere in the Slice app’s menu was this mentioned. Veggie pizza tasted pretty good but not wonderful. Sent a message to the app and they relayed it to Pizza Secret but all they offered was a 15% discount next time. There will be no next time.

Pizza Secret is some of the *best* Neapolitan pies I’ve had outside Italy. Their dough is perfectly chewy and crispy, their flavors are creative and thoughtful, and the ingredients are clearly fresh and high-quality. We enjoyed a pie with burrata and purple potato purée, and one with Italian sausage and a broccoli rabe pesto. SO delicious!!  We went during off-hours, around 3pm, so the place wasn’t very busy. Perhaps the best part was interacting with the owner - he was so genuine and passionate about his craft, saying his favorite thing is seeing people enjoy his pies. Will definitely be returning soon!

The food was delicious but the front of house was absolute chaos. Most restaurants have staff assigned to roles like host, bartender, waiters, and bus boys for good reason. Oddly enough, for such a small space Pizza Secret had enough staff, but people didn't seem to divide up responsibilities so they were all over the place doing everything frantically. This led to nobody managing the surge of people coming in for dinner (with reservations) before a show at the nearby Barclays Center, and with the cold outside they were crowding well into the middle of the restaurant. They clearly shouldn't have accepted any reservations that night since they couldn't manage their tables. In addition, their table layout is nonsensical: group tables should be along the wall, and tables of two should be in the middle of the space. By having 2 tables of two merely inches apart from each other stacked along the wall, the staff constantly had to reach over people dining. My recommendation would be to limit reservations during the prime hours before Barclays events to better manage expectations.
Good original Italian cuisine.
Makes artichoke pizza look like pizza hut. Pizza secret is the best pizza, Neapolitan or not, in the neighborhood.
Best Neapolitan pizza in New York in my opinion! Better than Ribalta, which I considered to be the number one before I knew about Pizza Secret.
The fresh mozzarella stuffed with pesto over arugula was incredible, and the staff very accommodating and gracious.

(Translated by Google) We love it! Beautiful restaurant in a quiet location and the quality of the food is unique! Very sympathetic owner. We will visit every restaurant in New York! Thank you.  (Original) We love it! Wunderschönes Restaurant in einer ruhigen Lage und die Qualität des Essens ist einmalig! Sehr sympathischer Besitzer. Wir werden bei jeden New York Besuch in diesem Restaurant vorbei schauen! Thank you.
Great place, excellent pizza - shouldn’t be a secret!
There was a bug in my pasta. When I told the manager about it, rather than apologizing he accused me of trying to blackmail him
Great pizza
This place was delish!! Everything was seasoned well and just a perfect little secret.

Stopped in by chance before an Islander game.  I loved the pizza and the Calzone and believe me I've had pizza in 100's of places including my own homemade pizza which is great.  I hope to go back soon.  Friendly place as well.

If you're looking for authentic top quality pizza look no further. Every time I travel from Washington DC to NY I make sure to stop at Pizza Secret so I can feel like I am back in Italy. Rosario is in the upper echelon of pizza chefs, not just in NYC, but in the world for his ability, style, and service. He really cares about his customers and only serves top quality.
If you are in New York and you are looking for a real Neapolitan pizza you have to come in this place. Very good service and top quality food!! Excellent!
Insanely good, go here before it gets huge (it will)

Best pizza I had in New York my favorite place to get it...guys from Naples Naples put their soul into it!you can feel it in every slice of pizza or in any meat ball...I recommend this place,pretty new but ready to blow your mind and your palate...enjoy...🍻🍕🍝❤️😇
Fantastic food and absolutely terrific and Charming service!
Great brick oven fired pizza. Good customer service
(Translated by Google) Good  (Original) Buono
Excellent, best Neapolitan in Brooklyn
Good food and quick service. Definitely a must to try the real wood fired neapolitan pizza in BK.
Delicious pizza, freshly made from their amazing wood stove. Italian-only beers, but a nice variety of neo style pizzas. Service was friendly and fast!
Great pizza and atmosphere

Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. The Americana was fantastic. The spicy honey oil was the perfect addition to pizza I didn't know that I was missing. We stumbled across the place on accident and decided to give it a shot and even though they were getting ready to close the food and service were fantastic. The owner Rosario checked on us and made sure we were enjoying the food and service. I'm still dreaming about this pizza. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Brooklyn.
Best in new york
Lovely Italian restaurant. We ordered a lasagna and a vegetarian pizza, and both were really delicious. The service was good as well. Highly recommended
This place is legit. From a native NYer who’s spent some time in Italy - you will be very glad you paid a visit to Pizza Secret.

There is one place that can compete with Pizza Secret in NYC: Roberta’s... the owner, Rosario, is always there, making pizzas by himself, the flour he uses comes from italy, produced organically. Rosario’s father and grandfather were pizza makers from Napoli. Go and eat in this new restaurant that draws on 100 years of experience. You’ll love it. İn six months, you’ll have six people waiting in line to get in...

This is closest thing you are going to get to the pizza napoletana . Great atmosphere, great place, great food ! Bravi !! Can’t wait to go back this week . I travel from dc and I only eat pizza there .
The worst service I’ve ever had. Took half an hour to give us a menu. Moved people from their table while eating, good food but horrific service.

Best Pizza I've EVER had (and I lived in Italy for 2 years)... This is our first time in Brooklyn and this has been just the most marvelous find! Highly recommended, the staff is super friendly and you won't be rushed!
Simply the best Neapolitan pizza I have ever had outside Naples
Hi this is Miriam from the Brooklyn Agency saying Hi. It is a real pleasure working with you guys
(Translated by Google) very good  (Original) bravissimo
Great home style brick oven pizza! Rosario is a true master of his craft! No picture can ever do this place justice, your just going to have to come in and see for yourself! The true taste of Napoli!

Americana is a must try and the secret spicy honey sauce is awesome! (Strong recommendation for your first visit) The chef said they are newly opened but I believe this place will soon become very popular! (Don’t order tea it will cost you $3.3 for each and it is just tea bag with hot water, this is the only thing I felt so disappointed lol)

I live in the neighborhood and there's a ton of good pizza places nearby, but this one is my favorite. It opened a few months ago and they just received their liquor license this past week.  It's hands down the best spot if you're looking for authentic Neapolitan pizza. Rosario, the owner, is from Naples and comes from a family of pizza-makers (his family owns Pizzeria Miracoli in Naples) and it definitely shows in the food that he makes.  The dough is especially amazing. My favorites on the menu are the Bufalina and the Americana (which has pepperoni and an awesome spicy honey oil).
TOP

On a 5th Ave corner, this new, family-friendly and warm restaurant will be one worth coming back to. The pizzaiolo is friendly and does great work, there are so many pies worth trying. A large selection of antipasti and pasta as well. The meatballs were fantastic. Will be back to try another pie. Only 4 stars for now because the service was lacking, but it may just because it's a new restaurant.
Delicious and authentic Italian food and pizza. The Americano pizza with spicy honey oil is heavenly. Airy atmosphere and good vibes. Get here early before the rest of Brooklyn discovers it 🙌🏼💯

Family-friendly atmosphere and reasonably priced. Excellent Neapolitan pies. Can’t compare to Artichoke because it’s a completely different type of pizza. The more great pizza choices in this neighborhood, the better!
The best
So freaking good!!

as a person who lived in italy and ate pizza all over the world, this is the real deal. they're a 3rd generation pizzaiolo family business. you won't get anything better and the pizza is done in a split second. great atmosphere, beautiful dark wood furniture, very friendly service. upscale interior with casual atmosphere, i came in wearing sports clothes and got great service. great place for a casual date. the salsiccina is a great tip. i'd give 6 stars if i could!

This is a beautiful New spot in Bk, a really nice corner right in front of Barclay Center. But what makes me come back is the amazing pizza and pasta. One of the Best I have ever had. Thank you so much for bringing a little corner of Naples in Ny
Very authentic Neapolitan pizza. Best in the neighborhood!
Legit Neapolitan pizza at a good price. Spotted this place yesterday during my stroll around the neighborhood. Definitely better than artichokes Joe’s across the street.
